channel.title: Life_in_10s on Echo's Blog

item.title: A Failed Race
item.description: EN The college entrance exam is over. The initial frenzy has gradually subsided into calm, so calm that it feels a bit empty. The bookshelf is full of unopened books by Tsangyang Gyatso and Nalan Xingde, rewards I envisioned for myself during my second and third years of high school. But now, they are covered in dust. I’d rather gossip than glance at those literary books. I opened “Ashes of Time,” and after five seconds, I clicked the red cross. Opened it again, and clicked again. The rough visuals deflated my once inflated expectations instantly. What a boring holiday! I accidentally found a diary from after the class divisions in my third year of high school: “All for the college entrance exam.” “This is my first wish, and also the goal.” “Ten months left: end of summer, autumn, winter, spring,
